snippet: An important hearing of the Senate Judiciary Committee could move the dynamics of the fight against laws restricting access to abortions in a positive direction.
abstract: Editorial supports the Women's Health Protection Act, measure that would safeguard reproductive rights of women all across the nation, regardless of where they live; notes bill would bar states from implementing laws that pretend to protect women's health while undermining their right to make childbearing decisions; holds while bill is unlikely to pass, Congressional hearing may serve to remove sheen of respectability from phony restrictions that have no medical value.
lead_paragraph: An important hearing of the Senate Judiciary Committee could move the dynamics of the fight against laws restricting access to abortions in a positive direction.
